job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Columbia, MO
pros: I am a graduate student in University of Missouri-Columbia. In order to finish my thesis, I need to do some projects and some research, so I choose to work as a graduate research assistance.
cons: The graduate research assistance has lots of things to do, you will not have too much personal time .

pros: Working for the University of Missouri Tour Team is a life changing experience. I have met some of the best people you could possibly imagine.
cons: They are not any downfalls to the position other than compensation. As a part-time college student the perks are amazing!

pros: Pension/Benefit plan, although they keep reducing it's quality and increasing employee contribution requirements.
cons: Upper management is an "insider club".  You are either in or out.  Most are out and recruitment from outside of always preferred over skilled, current staff.  And raises are minimal or zero % years after year.

job_title: Administrative Associate I in Columbia, MO
pros: The University of Missouri - Columbia is a great place to work.  It is one of the main employers in Columbia, MO.  They offer flexible schedules, great vacation and sick time, and retirement benefits.
cons: The pay is not the best however the culture is great.  They should focus more on personal growth, offer jobs where employees can move up instead of reaching a dead end.

pros: The hours and pay were great, person I work with was friendly, and work was easy.
cons: The people focus to much time on others and not on themselves. Times were I would have to make sure someone who wasn’t a manager wasn’t watching my every move. Some of the managers were also showing favoritism. They would let some people get away with things but others would get in trouble for the same thing.

job_title: Student Assistant in Kansas City, MO
pros: You can work and go to school with this job. It is easy and you can get alot of homework done.
cons: There are alot of annoying questions that students ask. Also you have to clock in on the slow computers, and you cannot be late.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Columbia, MO
pros:
50% off undergrad tuition after working for 10 years, some job stability, good benefits (full time) 
As a graduate student you don't pay for tuition
Clean campus
Plenty of parking
Good Gym 
Enrollment constantly growing so prospects are good
Maybe MU will become a better school in the field I am in in a few years
cons:
Constant construction
Gym very crowded when school first starts
Columbia is very dead when students are gone and campus is eerily empty

review_title: The right environment to do research
job_title: Senior Research Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: A good campus setting with some synergy that promotes advances in research. Mostly given autonomy to pursue research interests and to promote the university off campus.
cons: Non-tenure track personnel have fewer opportunities to increase their compensation as part of a statewide system based upon performance. Merit increase generally capped and given across the board regardless of performance.

review_title: University System is a Great Place to Work
pros: The section of the University System that I worked in had great co-workers.  Everyone is polite and friendly.  The University provides great benefits as well.  There are opportunities for job growth and advancement.  Continued education is encouraged.
cons: Lower pay compared to what you would get working elsewhere, but is made up for with the benefits.

pros: Flexible schedule, great supervisors, and it is easy to learn what you need to do. Pays above minimum wage, and there are chances for raises.
cons: Clients are hard to get a hold off, and if you can contact them, they don't always give all the information you need to complete your job.

pros: Most university jobs pay above minimum wage and work around the school year schedule, so you will get holiday breaks off work.
cons: Very little chance for promotions, and you will be stuck mostly doing the same job for four years

review_title: Saw the decline while I was there
pros: Columbia is a great college town that is cheap to live in. The university has many professors that are renown in the field, for Mizzou it is plant biology. Also George Smith won the Nobel so things are looking up
cons: Grad students aren't looked highly upon, true for most institutions, but recent affairs with law suit with Grad student Union means tensions are quite high.

review_title: It's been a quite good experience.
pros: A lot of freedom and flexibility in terms of course design and delivery.  Most of the colleagues are great. A lot of opportunities to teach the courses of your interest.
cons: Though not very bad, pay scale as a whole is not great. And, be prepared for the fact that it's a midwest university.

job_title: Front Desk Worker in Columbia, MO
pros: Managers were easy to work with and all your duties were clearly laid out.
cons: Lots of phone answering from parents, but you aren't able to answer all questions about their children because of privacy laws- this leads to a lot of frustrating conversations with angry parents. Be prepared for that daily stress.

job_title: Student Services Coordinator in Columbia, MO
pros: The students are amazing and motivated and most staff work for them. They take initiative and it's inspiring to be around young students.
cons: Leadership is terrible and no one advocates for their staff. You are really on your own here and there is not much teamwork and collaboration going on.

pros: Great benefits, fun working experience right out of college. Wide variety of tasks, no "typical day" because the work changes constantly. Plenty of opportunity to learn and grow.
cons: Poor instruction and organization from management. Management obviously lacks understanding of day to day work in the lab and constantly changes their expectations and wants from the research group.

review_title: Fast-paced and no two days are alike
pros: Always learning something new. Human Resources is always changing so where someone would think it is the same work day in and day out, it's really not.
cons: There really aren't any cons. Parking could be a con. Things are moving at such a fast pace that it would be nice to have a day to get caught up, but it's still exciting.

job_title: Programmer Analyst Specialist in Columbia, MO
pros:
The work-life balance is very good. 
The job is very stable. I think it is kinda hard to get fired here.
After all, there is no real competitor.
cons:
If you want to learn new technologies, this is not the ideal place.
If you want to do something creative, this is not the place.

pros: The hours are very flexible. The students you work with are usually extremely thankful and nice. Deffinently an enjoyable workplace.
cons: The one rude student I did have was unbearable. They refused to care about my time or actually learning the material

review_title: Not likely to work there ever again...
job_title: IT Business Analyst in Columbia, MO
pros: I loved the customers I dealt with on a daily basis.
cons: Other places pay much better and appreciate their employees in numerous and better ways than MU ever will.

review_title: Great opportunity, HR needs some work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: I Loved working at UMKC,  In the beginning, in the department I was in everyone was great.
cons: When It came time for me to make the choice of quitting my job because HR Harassed me and some employees were treating me awful. It could have been handled by HR a little better.

pros: This job gave me an opportunity to become a leader and interact with students. Its also a good working environment because majority of the part-time employees are students.
cons: Work schedule often conflicted with school and extra curricular activities. The managers were sometimes rude.

pros:
Pleasant coworkers
Standard work week with little to no overtime
Good benefits
Tons of sick time
cons:
Old-fashioned
Bureaucratic
Work was boring
No recognition for anything other than years of service
A lot of needless meetings

review_title: Department is running out of funding and putting the hurt and blame on students
pros: There are lots of faculty to potentially work with.  Cost of living is cheaper than most.
cons: no one has funding right now, department seems to blame students for all problems rather than evaluating what the department may be doing wrong

pros: The people and there ever changing spirit you get a gist of a little of every type of person there is.
cons: The con is the work is a little confusing based on task and how it designed management. But i guess they create jobs and thats a pro however that a whole other story in itself

review_title: A good job for a college student.
pros: Good experience to be gained for college students, fun working environment as well, as a tutor.  Good way to supplement the education of others.
cons: The pay is low, though above minimum wage.  Hours can be tough to get for most and must not be more than a little supplemental income.

job_title: Business & Innovations Program Leader in Columbia, MO
pros: The Small Business & Technology Development Center (SBTDC) is great for getting exposure to a wide range of fields and small businesses, from life sciences to traditional engineering to websites and programming.
cons: Constant juggling of clients and fields of knowledge, there can be lots of travel (a good thing if you like that though) which is most always in state.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Columbia, MO
pros: I do love working staying busy in a fast environment which this is. Good Culture and Values if everyone would follow.
cons: Its not to bad to work here but what makes it bad is the people that I work around in the ER there's communication barriers between registration and the nurse staff as well as with the doctors which makes is stressful.

pros: Interactions with the students and a great comradery among your peers, the University has provided me with a setting that allows me to be creative and brings joy to my everyday life
cons: There can be a lot of red tape or people in higher positions who don't understand what is needed to get things accomplished, however we make adjustments and move on.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Columbia, MO
pros: depends on professor, but i had a good one that allowed me to work at my own pace and on my own project, but was still available for help when i needed it
cons: I was an honors researcher which requires a large paper at the end of the term. This was very difficult to manage on top of other studies.

pros:
